Artefact.Name: Daemonblade
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Random Attacks (D6+3) special rule
Every ToHit roll of a 1 made by this character in close combat is resolved against himself - the character can never re-roll a To Hit roll of a 1
Artefact.Description: The wielder of a Daemonblade has the Random Attacks (D6 + 3) special rule. However, every To Hit roll of a 1 made by this character in close combat is resolved against himself; the character can never re-roll a To Hit roll of a 1.

Artefact.Name: Collar of Khorne
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Magic Resistance (3)
Artefact.Description: Daemon of Khorne or model with Mark of Khorne only. The character has the Magic Resistance (3) special rule.

Artefact.Name: Unholy Strike
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Instead of striking normally, the character can choose to make a single special Attack with double the character's Strength and has the Multiple Wounds (D3) special rule
Artefact.Description: Instead of striking normally, the character can choose to make a single special Attack. If he does so, and the Attack hits, the hit is resolved at double the character's Strength and has the Multiple Wounds (D3) special rule.

Artefact.Name: Flaming Breath
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Strength 4 Breath Weapon that has the Flaming Attacks special rule
Artefact.Description: The character has a Strength 4 Breath Weapon that has the Flaming Attacks special rule.

Artefact.Name: Chaos Familiar
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: +1 to all of his channelling attempts
Knows one extra spell than normal for his level
Artefact.Description: The character adds +1 to all of his channelling attempts and knows one extra spell than normal for his level.

Artefact.Name: Scaled Skin
Artefact.Description: The character has the Scaly Skin (5+) special rule.

Artefact.Name: Allure of Slaanesh
Artefact.Description: Model with Mark of Slaanesh only. Any opponent wishing to strike the character in close combat must first pass a Leadership test (test immediately before the model rolls To Hit). If the test is failed, that model cannot make any close combat attacks that phase. This does not affect Attacks that do not roll To Hit.

Artefact.Name: Poisonous Slime
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: 5+ Ward save against Poisoned Attacks
Artefact.Description: The character has the Poisoned Attacks special rule and a 5+ ward save against Poisoned Attacks.

Artefact.Name: Acid Ichor
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Whenever this character suffers an unsaved Wound in close combat, the model that inflicted that hit must pass an Initiative test or suffer a Strength 4 hit
Artefact.Description: Whenever this character suffers an unsaved Wound in close combat, the model that inflicted that hit must pass an Initiative test or suffer a Strength 4 hit. Wounds inflicted by Acid Ichor count towards the combat result.

Artefact.Name: Burning Body
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Flaming Attacks
5+ Ward save against Flaming Attacks
Artefact.Description: The character has the Flaming Attacks special rule and a 5+ Ward save against Flaming Attacks.

Artefact.Name: Soul Feeder
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Roll a D6 for every unsaved Wound inflicted by the character in close combat: for each result of a 6 rolled, he immediately regains a single lost Wound.
Artefact.Description: Roll a D6 for every unsaved Wound inflicted by the character in close combat. For each result of a 6 rolled, he immediately regains a single lost Wound.

Artefact.Name: Third Eye of Tzeentch
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Re-rolls ward save results of 1
Artefact.Description: Model with Mark of Tzeentch only. The character re-rolls ward save results of 1.

Artefact.Name: Nurgle's Rot
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: At the start of every Magic phase, every enemy model in base contact with the character suffers a single Strength 1 hit, with no armour saves allowed
Artefact.Description: Model with Mark of Nurgle only. At the start of every Magic phase, every enemy model in base contact with the character suffers a single Strength 1 hit, with no armour saves allowed.

Artefact.Name: Hideous Visage
Artefact.Description: The character has the Fear special rule. However, other models can never use this character's Leadership.

Artefact.Name: Hellfire sword
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Flaming attacks

After all close combat blows have been struck, roll a D6 for every foe slain: on the roll of a 6, the slain foe's body explodes, inflicting an additional D6 Strength 4 hits on the enemy unit with the Flaming Attacks special rule
At the end of each turns, roll a D6: on the roll of a 1, he suffers one Wound with no armour saves allowed
Artefact.Description: Close combat attacks made with the Hellfire Sword have the Flaming Attacks and Multiple Wounds (D3) special rules. No armour saves can be taken against Wounds caused by the Hellfire Sword. After all close combat blows have been struck, roll a D6 for every foe slain by the Hellfire Sword - on the roll of a 6, the slain foe's body explodes, inflicting an additional D6 Strength 4 hits on the enemy unit with the Flaming Attacks special rule. Unsaved Wounds inflicted in this way count towards the combat result. At the end of each of the wielder's turns, roll a D6; on the roll of a 1, he suffers one Wound with no armour saves allowed.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Change
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: If an enemy character or monster is slain in close combat, roll a D6: on the roll of a 4+, the model is transformed into a Chaos Spawn under the control of the owner of the Sword of Change
Artefact.Description: If an enemy character or monster is slain by the Sword of Change in close combat, roll a D6. On the roll of a 4+, the model is transformed into a Chaos Spawn under the control of the owner of the Sword of Change, exactly as if the enemy model were a Chaos Champion that had suffered a Spawndom result on the Eye of the Gods table.

Artefact.Name: Filth Mace
Artefact.Description: Model with Mark of Nurgle only. Close combat attacks made with the Filth Mace have the Poisoned Attacks special rule. Once the wielder has killed an enemy model in close combat, he immediately gains the Terror special rule and, from the start of the next Close Combat phase (friend or foe), all subsequent Attacks made with the Filth Mace that result in a successful Poisoned Attack have the Multiple Wounds (D3) special rule.

Artefact.Name: Helm of Many Eyes
Artefact.Description: The bearer of the Helm of Many Eyes counts his armour save as being one higher than normal. In addition, the bearer has both the Always Strikes First and Stupidity special rules.

Artefact.Name: Skull of Katam
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Can choose to consult Skull of Katam before attempting to channel power dice: if he does so, roll 6 dice instead of 1, but the bearer suffers a -1 Leadership penalty for the rest of the game for every result of a 1 rolled
Artefact.Description: The bearer of the Skull of Katam can choose to consult it before attempting to channel power dice. If he does so, roll 6 dice instead of 1. If the bearer consulted the Skull of Katam, he suffers a -1 Leadership penalty for the rest of the game for every result of a 1 rolled when channelling - if it is ever reduced to 0, he is immediately removed as a casualty. A Wizard with the Mark of Tzeentch may not re-roll channelling results of a 1 when using the Skull of Katam.

Artefact.Name: Chalice of Chaos
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Chalice of Chaos: consult the table
Artefact.Description: One use only. The bearer of the Chalice of Chaos may drink from it at the start of any phase. If he chooses to do so, roll a D6 and consult the table below.||D6 Result||1 Unworthy Fool: The imbiber immediately suffers a Wound, with no saves of any kind allowed.||2 Inhuman Speed: The imbiber gains the Always Strikes First special rule until the end of the turn.||3 Regenerating Flesh: The imbiber gains the Regeneration special rule until the end of the turn.||4 Dark Fortune: The imbiber gains a 5+ ward save until the end of the turn.||5 Daemonic Strength: The imbiber gains the Killing Blow special rule until the end of the turn.||6 Final Transformation: If the imbiber is already a Daemon Prince, he instead treats this result as Unworthy Fool. Otherwise, he must immediately take a Leadership test. If passed, he is gifted with Daemonhood, as described on the Eye of the Gods table on page 25. If failed, he is gifted with Spawndom, as described on the same table.

Artefact.Name: Pendant of Slaanesh
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Whenever character or his unit take a Break test, it is taken on one less dice than usual
For each unsaved Wound the bearer suffers, he gains +1 Attack for the rest of the battle
Artefact.Description: Model with Mark of Slaanesh only. The bearer of the Pendant of Slaanesh can only join units that have the Mark of Slaanesh. No other character may join the same unit as the bearer and he cannot join units that already contain a character. Whenever the bearer, or his unit, take a Break test, it is taken on one less dice than usual (note that a Break test cannot be passed with Insane Courage on a single D6). In addition, for each unsaved Wound the bearer suffers, he gains +1 Attack for the rest of the battle.

Artefact.Name: Blasted Standard
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Each time the character, or his unit, suffer a hit from a shooting attack, roll a D6 immediately before rolling To Wound: on the roll of 2+, the Strength of that hit is halved, if the result is a 1, the Strength of that hit is instead doubled
Artefact.Description: Model with Mark of Tzeentch only. Each time the bearer, or his unit, suffer a hit from a shooting attack, roll a D6 immediately before rolling To Wound. On the roll of 2+, the Strength of that hit is halved. However, if the result is a 1, the Strength of that hit is instead doubled. Attacks that do not roll To Wound, or that wound automatically, are not affected by the Blasted Standard.

Artefact.Name: Banner of Rage
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Will never lose their Frenzy, even if beaten in close combat
Artefact.Description: Model with Mark of Khorne only. The bearer of the Banner of Rage can only join units that are completely comprised of models with the Mark of Khorne. Only characters that have the Mark of Khorne may join the same unit as the bearer. Whilst the bearer is alive, neither he, nor his unit, can ever lose their Frenzy special rule. If the bearer joins a unit that has lost its Frenzy, the unit immediately regains the Frenzy special rule.

Artefact.Name: Giant Blade
Artefact.Description: Close combat attacks made with this sword are resolved at +3 Strength.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Bloodshed
Artefact.Description: The wielder has +3 Attacks.

Artefact.Name: Obsidian Blade
Artefact.Description: Armour saves cannot be taken against wounds caused by the Obsidian Blade.

Artefact.Name: Ogre Blade
Artefact.Description: Close combat attacks made with this sword are resolved at +2 Strength.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Strife
Artefact.Description: This wieider of the Sword of Strife has +2 Attacks.

Artefact.Name: Fencer's Blades
Artefact.Description: Paired weapons. The bearer has Weapon Skill 10.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Anti-Heroes
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: +1 Strength and +1 Attack for every enemy character in base contact
Artefact.Description: The bearer has +1 Strength and +1 Attack for every enemy character in base contact with him or his unit. These bonuses are calculated at the start of each round ol close combat and last until its end.

Artefact.Name: Spellthieving Sword
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: A Wizard that suffers unsaved wounds from the Spellthieving Sword loses one of his spells
Artefact.Description: A Wizard that suffers unsaved wounds from the Spellthieving Sword loses one of his spells (determined randomly) for each unsaved wound.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Swift Slaying
Artefact.Description: The wieider of the Sword of Swift Slaying has the Always Strikes First special rule.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Battle
Artefact.Description: The wieider tins +1 Attack.

Artefact.Name: Berserker Sword
Artefact.Description: The bearer has the Frenzy special rule and can never lose his Frenzy.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Might
Artefact.Description: Close combat attacks made with this sword are resolved at +1 Strength.

Artefact.Name: Gold Sigil Sword
Artefact.Description: Attacks from the Gold Sigil Sword are made at Initiative 10.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Striking
Artefact.Description: Attacks made with the Sword of Striking receive a +1 bonus to hit.

Artefact.Name: Biting Blade
Artefact.Description: Close combat attacks made by the Biting Blade are armour piercing.

Artefact.Name: Relic Sword
Artefact.Description: Attacks made with the Relic Sword will always wound on a 5+, unless they would normally need a lower result.

Artefact.Name: Shrieking Blade
Artefact.Description: The bearer causes Fear.

Artefact.Name: Tormentor Sword
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: A monster or character that suffers an unsaved wound has the Stupidity special rule for the rest of the game
Artefact.Description: A monster or character that suffers an unsaved wound from the Tormentor sword has the Stupidity special rule for the rest of the game.

Artefact.Name: Warrior Bane
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: A monster or character that suffers unsaved wounds from Warrior Bane permanently loses one Attack for each unsaved wound
Artefact.Description: A monster or character that suffers unsaved wounds from Warrior Bane permanently loses one Attack for each unsaved wound (to a minimum of Attacks 1).

Artefact.Name: Armour of Destiny
Artefact.Description: Heavy armour. The Armour of Destiny grants the wearer a 4+ ward save.

Artefact.Name: Trickster's Helm
Artefact.Description: The wearer counts his armour save as being one point higher than normal. Any successful roll to wound made against the wearer of the Trickster's Helm must be re-rolled.

Artefact.Name: Armour of Silvered Steel
Artefact.Description: The Armour of Silvered Steel grants its wearer a 2+ armour save that cannot be improved by any means.

Artefact.Name: Armour of Fortune
Artefact.Description: Heavy armour. The Armour of Fortune grants the wearer a 5+ ward save.

Artefact.Name: Helm of Discord
Artefact.Description: The wearer counts his armour save as being one point higher than normal. In addition, at the start of each Close Combat phase, choose an enemy character in base contact with the bearer or his unit. That character must immediately take a Leadership test. If the test is failed, the character succumbs to the helm's sibilant whispers of malice and jealousy. In this Close Combat phase, the victim cannot make attacks and is hit automatically.

Artefact.Name: Glittering Scales
Artefact.Description: Light armour. Enemies suffer a -1 to hit penalty when attempting to strike the wearer in close combat.

Artefact.Name: Shield of Ptolos
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: 1+ armour save against shooting attacks
Artefact.Description: Shield. The bearer has a 1+ armour save against shooting attacks.

Artefact.Name: Spellshield
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Magic Resistance(1)
Artefact.Description: Shield. The bearer gains Magic Resistance (1).

Artefact.Name: Gambler's Armour
Artefact.Description: Heavy armour. The Gambler's Armour grants the wearer a 6+ Ward save.

Artefact.Name: Dragonhelm
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: 2+ Ward save against flaming attacks
Artefact.Description: The wearer counts his armour save as being one point higher than normal. The wearer has a 2+ ward save against flaming attacks.

Artefact.Name: Enchanted Shield
Artefact.Description: Shield. The bearer counts his armour save as being two points higher than normal, rather than the usual one point that a shield would normally grant.

Artefact.Name: Charmed Shield
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: First hit suffered is discounted on a roll of 2+
Artefact.Description: Shield. One use only. The first hit suffered by the bearer of the Charmed Shield is discounted on a roll of 2+.

Artefact.Name: Talisman of Preservation
Artefact.Description: The Talisman of Preservation grants the bearer a 4+ Ward save.

Artefact.Name: Obsidian Lodestone
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Magic Resistance(3)
Artefact.Description: The Obsidian Lodestone grants Magic Resistance (3).

Artefact.Name: Talisman of Endurance
Artefact.Description: The Talisman of Endurance grants the bearer a 5+ Ward save.

Artefact.Name: Dawnstone
Artefact.Description: The bearer re-rolls failed armour saves.

Artefact.Name: Opal Amulet
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Opal Amulet bestows a 4+ Ward save against the first wound suffered by the bearer, after which its power fades and it cannot be used again during the game.

Artefact.Name: Obsidian Trinket
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Magic Resistance(1)
Artefact.Description: The Obsidian Trinket grants Magic Resistance (1).

Artefact.Name: Talisman of Protection
Artefact.Description: The Talisman of Protection grants the bearer a 6+ Ward save.

Artefact.Name: Seed of Rebirth
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Regeneration (6+) special rule
Artefact.Description: The bearer of the Seed of Rebirth has the Regeneration (6+) special rule.

Artefact.Name: Dragonbane Gem
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: 2+ Ward save against flaming attacks
Artefact.Description: The bearer of the Dragonbane Gem has a 2+ Ward save against flaming attacks.

Artefact.Name: Pidgeon Plucker Pendant
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: 5+ Ward save against wounds caused in close combat by models that have the Fly special rule
Artefact.Description: This item grants the bearer a 5+ Ward save against wounds caused in close combat by models that have the Fly special rule.

Artefact.Name: Luckstone
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: May re-roll single failed armour save
Artefact.Description: The Luckstone allows the bearer to re-roll single failed armour save.

Artefact.Name: Rampager's Standard
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: May re-roll charge distance dice
Artefact.Description: A unit with this magic standard can re-roll its charge distance dice.

Artefact.Name: Wailing Banner
Artefact.Description: A unit with this banner causes Terror in its enemies.

Artefact.Name: Ranger's Standard
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Strider
Artefact.Description: A unit with the Ranger's Standard has the Strider special rule.

Artefact.Name: Razor Standard
Artefact.Description: Models in a unit with the Razor Standard have the Armour Piercing special rule.

Artefact.Name: War Banner
Artefact.Description: A unit with this banner adds +1 to combat resolution.

Artefact.Name: Banner of Swiftness
Artefact.Description: Models in a unit with the Banner of Swiftness have +1 to their Movement characteristic.

Artefact.Name: Lichebone Pennant
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Magic Resistance(1)
Artefact.Description: Models in a unit with the Lichebone Pennant have Magic Resistance (1).

Artefact.Name: Standard of Discipline
Artefact.Description: Models in a unit with the Standard of Discipline have +1 Leadership, but cannot use the General's Inspiring Presence special rule.

Artefact.Name: Banner of Eternal Flame
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Flaming Attacks
Artefact.Description: Models in a unit with the Banner of Eternal Flame have Flaming Attacks.

Artefact.Name: Gleaming Pennant
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Сan re-roll first failed Leadership test
Artefact.Description: One use only. A unit with the Gleaming Pennant can re-roll its first failed Leadership test.

Artefact.Name: Scarecrow Banner
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Сauses Fear in models with the Fly special rule
Artefact.Description: A unit with the Scarecrow Banner causes Fear in models with the Fly special rule.

Artefact.Name: Book of Ashur
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: +1 bonus on attempts to cast and dispel
Artefact.Description: The bearer receives a +1 bonus on attempts to cast and dispel.

Artefact.Name: Feedback Scroll
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Once per game, after the enemy spell has been resolved, roll a dice for every dice used to cast the spell, the casting Wizard takes a wound for every result of 5+ rolled, with no armour saves allowed
Artefact.Description: One use only. When an enemy spell has been cast, a Wizard who has a Feedback Scroll can read it instead of attempting to dispel the spell. The spell is cast as normal, but, after the spell has been resolved, roll a dice for every dice used to cast the spell. The casting Wizard takes a wound for every result of 5+ rolled, with no armour saves allowed.

Artefact.Name: Scroll of Leeching
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Once per game, after the enemy spell has been resolved, add a number of dispel dice to your pool equal to the number of dice used to cast the spell
Artefact.Description: One use only. When an enemy spell has been cast, a Wizard who has a Scroll of Leeching can read it instead of attempting to dispel the spell. The spell is cast as normal, but, after the spell has been resolved, the bearer of the scroll adds a number of dispel dice to his pool equal to the number of dice used to cast the spell (remember that your dispel pool cannot exceed 12 dice).

Artefact.Name: Sivejir's Hex Scroll
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Once per game, after the enemy spell has been resolved, the enemy wizard must roll equal to or under his wizard level on a D6, if he fails he becomes a small, slimy toad
Artefact.Description: One use only. When an enemy spell has been cast, a Wizard who has a Hex Scroll can read it instead of attempting to dispel the spell. The spell is cast as normal, but a portion of the spell's energy is transformed and redirected at the caster. The enemy wizard can resist the spell's effects by rolling equal to or under his wizard level on a D6. If he fails, an amphibian transformation takes hold and he becomes a small, slimy toad! Whilst transformed, the wizard cannot channel or cast spells, all of his magic items and mundane equipment (armour, weapons, etc.) temporarily stop working and all of his characteristics are reduced to 1 (except for his wounds, which are unaffected). His controlling player can roll a D6 at the start of each of his subsequent magic phases; the spell dissipates on a roll of 4+ and the wizard returns to his normal form (but still attempts to eat flies for several days afterward).

Artefact.Name: Power Scroll
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Once per game, during one casting attempt any roll of a double will cause Irresistible Force (and a Miscast)
Artefact.Description: One use only. A Power Scroll can be used when the Wizard makes a casting attempt. During that casting attempt, any roll of a double will cause irresistible force (and a miscast).

Artefact.Name: Wand of Jet
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Once per game, can increase one of his casting results by an additional +D6, after other casting dice have been rolled
Artefact.Description: One use only. The bearer can increase one of his casting results by an additional +D6, after other casting dice have been rolled. This extra power dice can contribute to casting a spell with Irresistible Force (and a Miscast).

Artefact.Name: Forbidden Rod
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Once per game, adds +D6 dice in the power pool and inflicts D3 wounds
Artefact.Description: One use only. The forbidden rod adds +D6 dice in the power pool at the start of the caster's own magic phase, but also inflicts D3 wounds on the bearer (with no armour saves allowed).

Artefact.Name: Trickster's Shard
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Once per game, declare you are using Shard at the start of one of your magic phases, for the duration of the phase, when one of spells is dispelled by an enemy wizard, on a 5+, that wizard surfers a wound with no armour saves allowed
Artefact.Description: One use only. Declare you are using this item at the start of one of your magic phases. For the duration of the phase, when one of the bearer's spells is dispelled by an enemy wizard, roll a D6. On a 5+, that wizard surfers a wound with no armour saves allowed.

Artefact.Name: Earthing Rod
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Once per game, can re-roll the Miscast
Artefact.Description: One use only. If the wizard rolls on the miscast table he can re-roll the result.

Artefact.Name: Dispell Scroll
Artefact.Description: One use only. When an enemy spell has been cast, a wizard who has a dispel scroll can read it instead of attempting to dispel the spell by using dispel dice. This automatically dispels the enemy spell; no dice roll is required. Note that even a dispel scroll will not help if the spell has been cast with Irresistible Force. Note also that a dispel scroll cannot be used to dispel spells that remain in play other than at the moment they are cast.

Artefact.Name: Power Stone
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Wizard can declare that he is using the power stone immediately before casting a spell. If he does so, two extra dice are added to the power dice that he is going to roll (you still need to roll at least one dice from the power pool).

Artefact.Name: Sceptre of Stability
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Once per game, can choose to increase one of his dispel results by an additional +D6, after his other dispel dice have been rolled
Artefact.Description: One use only. The bearer can choose to increase one of his dispel results by an additional +D6, after his other dispel dice have been rolled. This extra dispel dice can contribute to dispelling with Irresistible Force.

Artefact.Name: Channelling Staff
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: +1 to all of his channeling attempts
Artefact.Description: The Wizard adds +1 to all of his channeling attempts.

Artefact.Name: Scroll of Shielding
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Once per game, after the enemy spell has been resolved, the target of the spell is granted a 4+ Ward save against any wounds caused by the spell
Artefact.Description: One use only. When an enemy spell has been cast, a Wizard who has a Scroll of Shielding can read it instead of attempting to dispel the spell. The spell is cast as normal, but the target of the spell is granted a 4+ Ward save against any wounds caused by the spell.

Artefact.Name: Wizarding Hat
Artefact.Description: The wearer is treated as being a Level 2 Wizard who can use a randomly chosen spell lore. However, he also has the Stupidity special rule.

Artefact.Name: Fozzrik's Folding Fortress
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: After deployment zones have been agreed, but before the armies have been deployed, place a watchtower building in your deployment zone to represent rhe Folding Fortress
Artefact.Description: After deployment zones have been agreed, but before the armies have been deployed, place a watchtower building (or scratch-built structure of a similar size) in your deployment zone to represent rhe Folding Fortress. This is treated as a standard building. If you do not have a suitable building to place, you cannot use Fozzrik's Folding Fortress.

Artefact.Name: Arabyan Carpet
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Fly
Artefact.Description: Infantry or monstrous infantry models on foot only. The owner of this magical carpet has the Fly special rule. However, he cannot join units.

Artefact.Name: Crown of Command
Artefact.Description: The bearer of the Crown of Command has the Stubborn special rule.

Artefact.Name: Healing Potion
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Once per battle recovers D6 Wounds lost in the battle
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Healing Potion can be drunk at the start of the controlling player's turn. The imbiber immediately recovers D6 Wounds lost in the battle.

Artefact.Name: Featherfoe Torc
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Flying creatures (and their riders) must re-roll successful rolls to hit against the bearer (and any unit he is with) in close combat
Artefact.Description: Flying creatures (and their riders) must re-roll successful rolls to hit against the bearer (and any unit he is with) in close combat.

Artefact.Name: Ruby Ring of Ruin
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Bound spell, Power level 3: Fireball spell from Lore of Fire
Artefact.Description: Bound spell (power level 3). The Ruby Ring of Ruin contains the Fireball spell (see the Lore of Fire).

Artefact.Name: The Terrifying Mask of Eee!
Artefact.Description: The wearer of this mask causes Terror. However, other models can never use his Leadership.

Artefact.Name: Potion of Strength
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Once per battle at the start of any player's turn has +3 Strength until the end of the turn
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Potion of Strength can be drunk at the start of any player's turn. The imbiber has +3 Strength until the end of the turn.

Artefact.Name: Potion of Toughness
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Once per battle at the start of any player's turn has +3 Toughness until the end of the turn
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Potion of Toughness can be drunk at the start of any player's turn. The imbiber has +3 Toughness until the end of the turn.

Artefact.Name: The Other Trickster's Shard
Artefact.Description: Models in base contact with the bearer (friends and foes) must re-roll successful ward saves.

Artefact.Name: Ironcurse Icon
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: The character (and any unit he is with) have 6+ Ward save against war machine weapons
Artefact.Description: The character (and any unit he is with) gain a 6+ ward save against war machine weapons.

Artefact.Name: Potion of Foolhardiness
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Once per battle character has the Immune to Psychology and the Devastating Charge special rules until the end of the player turn
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Potion of Foolhardiness can be drunk at the start of any player's turn. The imbiber has the Immune to Psychology and the Devastating Charge special rules until the end of the player turn.

Artefact.Name: Potion of Speed
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Once per battle at the start of any player's turn has +3 Initiative until the end of the turn
Artefact.Description: One use only. The Potion of Speed can be drunk at the start of any player's turn. The imbiber has +3 Initiative until the end of the turn.

Option.Name: Mark of Nurgle
Option.SpecialRuleDescription: -1 to hit shooting and -1 WS in close combat

Option.Name: Venom Tail
Option.SpecialRuleDescription: Additional Poisoned Attack with Multiple Wounds (2) special rules, +1 To Hit bonus if it is targeted against a unit in the Manticore's rear arc.

Option.Name: Mark of Nurgle
